paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the TTR gene variants, specifically TTR Y114C and TTR V30M, in the context of familial amyloid polyneuropathy (FAP). It provides insights into their pathogenic mechanisms, functional data, and penetrance information.

functional_data.summary: The TTR Y114C mutation led to an increase in monomeric TTR and impaired autophagy.

variants.segregation_data: The TTR Y114C mutation was identified in a Chinese family with FAP.
variants.additional_notes: The study suggests that the TTR Y114C mutation has different clinical manifestations compared to TTR V30M.
key_quotes: We have recently published the first report of a TTR Tyr114Cys (TTR Y114C) mutation in a Chinese family with TTR FAP.
The results of Western blotting and immunofluorescence indicated that autophagy in TTR Y114C was significantly downregulated.

functional_data.summary: The TTR V30M mutation also led to an increase in monomeric TTR.

variants.segregation_data: The TTR V30M mutation was used as a positive control in the study.
variants.additional_notes: The study indicates that TTR V30M has different clinical manifestations compared to TTR Y114C.
key_quotes: TTR V30M represented the positive control.
The monomer of TTR V30M was increased by approximately 2.78 times, compared with wild-type TTR.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding TTR variants were extracted from the main text.
